pr_title: SAMZA-2561: Add config map to DiagnosticsManager

timeline.bodyText:
Why do we want to add the config to the metric-header?
That way the entire config map (potentially 10s of MB of data) will be emitted in every message.
This is NOT what we want to do right?
Instead we want to emit it in the MetricsMessage, but exactly once at container start (first message) not in every message.
timeline.author: rmatharu

replies.bodyText: +1 I agree we should only pick the fields we are interested in. I suggest we create a versioned model (JSON serializable) that holds the fields we are interested in.
replies.author: abhishekshivanna

replies.bodyText: Removed the config from the MetricsHeader.
replies.author: PawasChhokra

timeline.author: rmatharu

timeline.bodyText:
See comment above,
config is not required to be in the header.
timeline.author: rmatharu
rmatharu

timeline.bodyText: Because we dont need to add it to the header, we dont need to pass it in here.
timeline.author: rmatharu
rmatharu

timeline.bodyText: Please add additional configs to make it somewhat representative of the configs that we want to emit.
timeline.author: rmatharu
rmatharu
rmatharu
rmatharu

timeline.bodyText: config is a non-primitive object, cast to Map<String, String> here before serializing and adding into the map; similar to how containerModels are added above.
timeline.author: rmatharu

timeline.bodyText:
Since we will serialize as Map<String, String>
getFromMetricsMessage will return a Map<String, String>
that needs to be converted to Config like this:
new MapConfig(getFromMetricsMessage(GROUP_NAME_FOR_DIAGNOSTICS_MANAGER, CONFIG));
timeline.author: rmatharu

timeline.bodyText: Config does not define an equals method, so not sure how this test is working.
timeline.author: rmatharu

replies.bodyText: This invokes the equals method of MapConfig class.
replies.author: PawasChhokra

timeline.author: rmatharu
